title: PROBLEM SINCE LAST NIGHT : Game won't launch after champion select.
body:
I'm not the only one with this problem and this is what was happening last night.

It keeps saying reconnect or cancel, reconnect doesnt do shit. Client opens back up and you can skip waiting for stats, try to join another game but you can push find match but it won't do anything. I have to close client, reopen and login and then league will launch with a black screen and repeat with the reconnect or cancel option. 
People are getting leaver buster for this shit, and even if they manage to reconnect they're at a disadvantage because their opposing lane has a lead.

It's not a firewall issue or anything like that, it's a problem on riots end, it's happening to multiple people in every game.

I want my LP back for this game! THIS IS BULLSHIT. 
https://imgur.com/a/24wnrHU

replies.body:
For those still having the issue, it could be worth letting Optus know you are having problems with their service.

There's a [thread on the Optus boards](https://yescrowd.optus.com.au/t5/Broadband-Telephony/League-of-legends-message/m-p/422504#M51254/jump-to/first-unread-message) about this issue.

It may be worth adding your voice there to help them understand how many of their customers are affected...

I mean no offence here, but you cannot expect the little man to pull the chariot. I understand that you guys care for the little guys, but simply our voice does not matter with in this, if you look at the answer section of the forum and look at when Optus actually reply to the forum posts, "Yesterday day 7:29pm (4/5/18), Wednesday 11:40 am (2/5/18)" there is no continuity to the time (specifically now), nor is their a continuity to how many are answered. There is also the problem that if you look through the unanswered section with relevant dates to the quote, and reduce to the actual responses, you can see that their are ALOT of unanswered actual questions  and I understand your attempt to raise the matter to Optus through the viewership of the thread and how many comments, though I think that the 8% of the community that is probably being affected by this (including myself) needs to see formal talk and representation, RIOT should be talking with Optus and informing us over Twitter or Forum posts demonstrating with examples where necessary , being vocal about the problem to the community or people affected, this isn't RIOT's mistake, RIOT shouldn't be the one being on the backfoot.
You said it all, thanks

Hey folks,

As Gehirn said below, we're on the case and trying to identify what the root cause of this might be.  Can anyone still having the issue confirm what ISP they are on and what state/territory they are in?

Cheers
Mindstar

NSW, Optus.

Can you tell me if we are going to the LP back?

Please see Mindstar's response for an update.

As for LP, this can't be edited due to how adversely this can affect LP and MMR calculations in future games, even for large scale service issues like this. If you contact player support, they may offer a more detailed explanation. I can see you have a ticket in the works already, and I've given support all the info around this issue to ensure that they are removing leaverbuster penalties where applicable. Though they might not begin getting to these tickets until the early morning.

Can I at least get my rewards for a normal game as I came back and helped my team win why should I get punished if I joined back and help my team win, cause I finished one of the riot mission but due to the issue it said I was unable to collect rewards due to afk WHICH WASNT MY FAULT cause of the unable to connect

That's rather frustrating seeing as I put in roughly 40 minutes of my time into a game TWICE for LP which each game doesn't even give me a reward at the end other than XP and you take away the only reward that I play for and then basically say "unlucky".

Not even until about 3 hours after I put up a post about this did riot put up a warning not to play ranked? You guys should have acted quicker for this. I have seen you guys act quicker and give loss prevention to most losses and the people who arent affected are the ones that benefit from it and not the others who are.  Surely there should be something to compensate for the loss. 

You can't even give me 2 loss prevention games? REALLY? That's fucked. It's literally not even something that I could control, I'm tilted, this is bullshit. I've dropped up and down from s1 to s2 constantly all week and now this bullshit happens.
I didn't get any xp or any mastery points it said afking isn't rewarded it wasn't even my fault  I joined back and played for 40 minutes and helped my team win

Loss prevention is a server wide effect, and also not something they can apply after the fact. There isn't really anything they can do for you. Even if they were to add that LP back it would royally screw over your MMR and LP gains and you'd likely be worse off for it in the end.

Well maybe they should implement something like that for future causes. 

Thinking about it, I guess Riot can't help because it's not their fault. It still doesn't feel fair for me though as it's basically losing 2 hours and then playing another 2 hours to get a point that I was already at.

I'm not too salty about it anymore as I've had time to calm down about it and won another 2 games to get the LP back, but the problem persisted in the 3rd game I attempted to join and managed to get through. the other team had a remake (probably experiencing the same problem). So I didn't bother to play as i would have been enraged again :@

Hi folks

Updating with what we've seen so far.

There seems to be some kind of network routing issue somewhere between Optus and the LoL servers (there is no direct connection between the two).  This issue seems to be intermittently affecting a small number of players - with the symptoms described in the OP.  While the site is unclear, optus do seem to be reporting a number of ongoing voice/data issues on their [network status](https://www.optus.com.au/about/network/service-status) page today.

The network engineering team at Riot have attempted re-routing traffic from LoL to Optus out through a different ISP in an attempt to mitigate the issues, however this appears to have had little impact.

At this stage, if you are affected by the issue you will likely need to wait until Optus are able to resolve their ongoing data and network issues.   In that case I'd suggest steering clear of ranked until you are sure you can reliably connect to games.

Cheers
Mindstar

PS: An alternative option **MAY ** be to connect to LoL via a VPN service, which could get  your traffic out of Optus via a slightly different path.  If anyone has success in testing this, please update here as I'm sure other players would like to know.

including me i live in VIC and i have optus my internet  used to be stable mostly at 30 to 40 ping  at night only due to internet traffic during the night   but recently my ping is normal (during the day) when no one is their at home. but when everyone(during the night) the ping is 60 and goes up to 300  ms and fluctuates constantly and i play and main Cassiopeia and having good internet is something important when playing this champ.

1. Update your graphics card drivers.
2. Update your DirectX: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35 (never DL anything DirectX from anywhere except Microsoft).
3. Disable and remove any custom skins or third party programs interacting with the game.
4. Run a client repair: Settings gear in the top right of the client > Initiate Full Repair
5. Clean reinstall your League of Legends with the Hextech Repair Tool: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool
6. Contact support: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

Test in a custom game after each step to see if the issue is fixed. The most likely to work is the clean reinstall, but it's good practice to do the first 3 anyway.
